subject: AI & Agents
title: Accuracy Is Not Enough
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Accuracy Is Not Enough.

hook.text: A model that predicts 'no cancer' every time is 99% accurate ‚Äî because only 1% have cancer.

buildup.text: When classes are imbalanced, accuracy becomes a misleading metric.

discovery.text: Precision asks: 'Of those I flagged, how many were correct?' Recall asks: 'Of those that exist, how many did I find?'

twist.text: You can't maximize both. Catching all cancers means more false positives.

climax.text: The F1 score balances precision and recall into a single number.

punchline.text: The right metric depends on the cost of being wrong.

quiz.question: Why is accuracy alone misleading for imbalanced datasets?
options: A model can achieve high accuracy by always predicting the majority class
Accuracy always gives the same result
